definition: to be honest/to show sincerity

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
sincere/authentic/really/truly
variant of 開誠布公|开诚布公[kai1 cheng2 bu4 gong1]
lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded/plain speaking/Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves./to put one's cards on the table
variant of 開誠布公|开诚布公[kai1 cheng2 bu4 gong1]
lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded/plain speaking/Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves./to put one's cards on the table
candid and open (idiom)

sentences.english: I wish everybody speak frankly and sincerely , put all cards on table.
sentences.chinese: 我希望大家开诚布公，把问题摆到桌面上谈清楚。

sentences.english: During the talk among the comrades, nothing should be concealed.
sentences.chinese: 同志间的交谈应该是开诚相见。

sentences.english: I hope eve4rybody should be honest and put up all question on the table.
sentences.chinese: 我希望大家开诚布公，把问题摆到桌面上谈清楚。

sentences.english: Be open with your partner about what's making you angry.
sentences.chinese: 开诚布公的告诉你的伴侣你为什么生气。

sentences.english: So face these numbers together, openly and honestly.
sentences.chinese: 所以开诚布公的共同面对这些数据。

sentences.english: I hope everyone talk frankly and openly to deal with the question.
sentences.chinese: 我希望大家开诚布公，把问题摆到桌面上谈清楚。

sentences.english: I hope that we can be be fair to each other, and take about the issues clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我希望大家开诚布公，把问题摆到桌面上谈清楚。

sentences.english: We can only reach agreement if we both put our cards on the table.
sentences.chinese: 我们双方只有开诚布公来谈才能达成协议。

sentences.english: You can't control, and revelation works better than concealment.
sentences.chinese: 你无法控制，而开诚布公比遮遮掩掩效果更好。

sentences.english: Open communication about your finances will help your marriage be successful.
sentences.chinese: 开诚布公的理财交流能使你的婚姻生活更顺利。

sentences.english: You don't mind my being frank, do you?
sentences.chinese: 我和你开诚相见，你不在意吧？

sentences.english: Open-ended questions make people open up to you.
sentences.chinese: 提出开放式的题目使别人向你开诚。

sentences.english: I wish a open conversation to put all cards on the table.
sentences.chinese: 我希望大家开诚布公，把问题摆到桌面上谈清楚。

sentences.english: And do, please, be frank with us.
sentences.chinese: 请务必和我们开诚相见。

sentences.english: I had aman-to-man talk with him about the problem last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上我和他对这个话题开诚布公地谈了谈。

definition: public land/land in common use

definition: to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
candid and open (idiom)
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
to lay one's cards on the table
lit. fluently saying all one wants (idiom); to preach freely on one's favorite topic/to hold forth to one's heart's content
a long talk
to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
to forget former enmity (idiom)
(to express one's) true feelings/what is on one's mind/secret mind
lit. to exchange weapons of war for gifts of jade and silk (idiom)/fig. to turn hostility into friendship
